title: Eagles' Dickerson injured in practice, exits on cart
content: Eagles Pro Bowl left guard Landon Dickerson was helped off the field and carted indoors after suffering an apparent right leg injury during the team's open practice Sunday night.

title: Aces' Wilson first with 30-point, 20-rebound game
content: A'ja Wilson had 32 points and 20 rebounds, becoming the first player in WNBA history with 30-plus points and at least 20 rebounds in a game.

title: Rose rallies late, tops Spaun in St. Jude playoff
content: Justin Rose made up a three-shot deficit over the last five holes against hard-luck Tommy Fleetwood, and then made two birdies in a playoff against U.S. Open champion J.J. Spaun to win the FedEx St. Jude Championship on Sunday.

title: Raleigh clubs MLB-best 45th HR in Mariners' win
content: Cal Raleigh hit his major-league-leading 45th home run in a four-run first inning, and Seattle hung on for a 6-3 victory over Tampa Bay on Sunday.

title: Bills delivers Pennsylvania first LLSWS since '78
content: Behind Reagan Bills' two-way heroics, Johnstown, Pennsylvania, defeated Floyds Knobs, Indiana, 1-0 on Sunday to win the state's first Little League Softball World Series since 1978.

title: Olympian Rivera, 17, wins at U.S. championships
content: Hezly Rivera, a 17-year-old Olympic gold medalist, pulled away for a victory at the U.S. gymnastics championships Sunday.

title: With Messi out, Orlando drops Miami to 6th in rout
content: Luis Muriel scored a goal in each half and Mart√≠n Ojeda had a goal and an assist to lead Orlando City to a 4-1 victory over Inter Miami on Sunday night.

title: MLB playoff contender tiers: The locks, teams with work to do and the long shots
content: As hot streaks and cold spells jumble the postseason picture, here's how sure we are that your team will be playing in October.

title: Online predators prey on young athletes using sextortion
content: A Michigan teen was goaded into sharing an intimate photo that scammers threatened to expose unless he paid up.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Napoli join Everton in battle for Jack Grealish
content: Napoli have joined Everton in the race for Jack Grealish. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Do Draft list: Henry, Purdy, Kelce among players being undervalued
content: In the perennial counterpart to the Do Not Draft list, Eric Karabell discusses players who are being underappreciated in fantasy football drafts.

title: Shane van Gisbergen wins fourth race this season
content: Shane van Gisbergen tied a Cup Series record with his fourth straight road-course victory, blowing out the competition again at Watkins Glen International.

title: üèà Ranking all 136 FBS teams ahead of the season
content: From Tier 1 to Tier 20, David Hale ranks all 136 college football program into tiers ahead of the 2025 season.

title: üèÜ Passan's 2025 MLB trade deadline awards
content: Here's what we learned from this year's deals -- and titles for the teams with the most interesting elements of trade season.

title: üèÄ Crypto group says it organized sex toy tosses
content: A self-described cryptocurrency enthusiast told ESPN that the recent sex toy stunts that have disrupted WNBA games were orchestrated by a group he is involved in.

title: üèà ESPN acquiring NFL Network, RedZone from NFL
content: ESPN is acquiring the NFL Network and other NFL media assets, including the linear rights to the league's popular RedZone channel, in a deal that will see the NFL get a 10% equity stake in the all-sports network, it was announced.

title: üßÇ 49ers' Kittle bemoans NFL's smelling salts ban
content: The NFL is banning the use of smelling salts and ammonia packets before and during all games, a ruling that has upset 49ers TE George Kittle.

title: üëä Khabib hopes McGregor changes lifestyle
content: Retired mixed martial arts legend Khabib Nurmagomedov said he hopes former rival Conor McGregor changes how he is living or "it will be punishment all his life."

title: Brewers pitcher Jacob Misiorowski draws rare Pok√©mon Charizard card after win over Mets
content: The Milwaukee Brewers' vibes were high when they pulled a rare Pok√©mon card after extending their win streak to seven.

title: Dean Burmester wins LIV Chicago in three-way playoff
content: Dean Burmester beat Jon Rahm and Josele Ballester in a three-way playoff Sunday to win LIV Golf Chicago.

title: 'I want it to be my life': Why Patrick Mahomes is much more than a celebrity product endorser
content: For an active athlete of his stature, the Chiefs QB has been unusually involved in his coffee brand's coast-to-coast growth.

title: How Jordyn Jackson, Saniyah Hall fit at Maryland, USC
content: Breaking down the fits of every five-star commitment, including No. 1 Saniyah Hall and No. 8 Jordyn Jackson.

title: Texas to Pennsylvania: Can you ace the last 'SportsCenter' 50-in-50 quiz?
content: Close out the "SportsCenter" 50-state road trip with nine questions from the Lone Star State to the Keystone State and several in between.

title: Vote ‚Äòchori‚Äô clamour grows in Karnataka: It‚Äôs CM‚Äôs aides vs DKS supporters
content: Cracks appear within Karnataka's Congress as minister KN Rajanna publicly contradicted Rahul Gandhi's claims of vote theft in the Lok Sabha elections, suggesting the party failed to address voter list irregularities during its own governance. This sparked a backlash from Deputy CM DK Shivakumar's supporters, accusing Rajanna of undermining the party.

title: Journalist or terrorist? Who was Anas al-Sharif? Al Jazeera reporter killed in Israeli strike
content: An Al Jazeera journalist, Anas al-Sharif, was killed in an Israeli strike in Gaza City along with four colleagues, prompting condemnation from the broadcaster and press freedom groups. Al-Sharif, a prominent voice covering the war, had previously warned of intense bombardment and expressed his commitment to conveying the truth.

title: Where is Dhankhar? Sanjay Raut writes to Amit Shah; asks 'what happened to VP?'
content: Amidst growing concerns, Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut has urged Home Minister Amit Shah to disclose the whereabouts and health status of former Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar, who resigned unexpectedly in July. Raut's letter highlights the lack of information since Dhankhar's resignation, fueling rumors of confinement and prompting calls for transparency.

title: 'India missing Hardik Pandya-like allrounder in overseas Tests'
content: Former New Zealand all-rounder Craig McMillan lauded Shubman Gill's captaincy during the recent Test series against England, emphasising the importance of establishing a distinct team identity. McMillan highlighted India's need for a Hardik Pandya-like all-rounder in Test cricket and commented on England's 'Bazball' approach under Brendon McCullum.

title: Noida daycare horror: Attendant slaps, punches, bites, throws toddler; owner watched
content: In Noida's Sector 137, a 15-month-old was allegedly assaulted at 'Blippi' daycare. The attendant, Sonali, is accused of slapping, hitting, and biting the toddler. The owner, Charu, allegedly watched without intervening. The mother discovered bite marks and reviewed CCTV footage, leading to a police complaint.

title: Nvidia CEO checks salaries of company's 42,000 employees; says: It's a strategy that‚Ä¶
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang personally reviews the compensation of all 42,000 employees monthly, utilizing machine learning to optimize the process. He dismisses rumors of secret stock options, emphasizing generous compensation for all workers. Huang believes in prioritizing employee well-being, which he feels drives overall success. This strategy has significantly benefited Nvidia's leadership, creating billionaires within his management team.

title: Gold price prediction: What's the gold rate outlook for August 11
content: Gold price prediction today: Gold prices are projected to remain range-bound amid global economic uncertainties. Last week, prices hit record highs domestically due to rate cut expectations and a weak US jobs report. A false tariff report briefly spiked prices before a correction. Market focus now shifts to key US inflation and retail sales data.

title: Suspected snag: Air India Thiruvananthapuram-Delhi flight diverts to Chennai
content: Air India flight AI 2455 from Thiruvananthapuram to Delhi, carrying MPs and other passengers, safely diverted to Chennai due to a suspected technical issue and bad weather. A go-around was executed during the initial landing attempt, heightening passenger anxiety. While Air India denies a near runway collision, passengers have urged investigation into the incident.

title: Is this the end for Ro-Ko? Rohit, Virat could be playing their last ODI series Down Under
content: Speculation surrounds the ODI futures of Indian cricket legends Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli as the BCCI contemplates the 2027 World Cup strategy. While both remain comfortable in the format, their recent inactivity raises questions.

title: Sam Altman on Elon Musk: All day he does is tweeting, 'how much OpenAI sucks, our model is bad and ...
content: Sam Altman, CEO of OpenAI, has downplayed Elon Musk's criticisms of OpenAI and its new GPT-5 model, stating he doesn't focus much on Musk's opinions. This response follows Musk's claim that OpenAI would "eat Microsoft alive" after Microsoft integrated GPT-5 across its platforms. Altman highlighted Musk's past negative comments about OpenAI's models, questioning the Tesla CEO's current stance.

title: Voter 'fraud' row: INDIA bloc MPs to march from Parliament to EC; 'no permission,' say police
content: The India bloc announced a march from Parliament to the Election Commission to protest the Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls in Bihar and alleged voter fraud in the 2024 elections. Delhi Police stated that no permission was sought for the protest. The opposition raised concerns about fake forms and discrepancies in voter lists, demanding electronic data for verification.

title: 'Coolie' advance booking smashes Rs 50 crore mark, set for historic opening
content: Rajinikanth's 'Coolie', directed by Lokesh Kanagaraj, is creating a box office frenzy ahead of its release. Worldwide advance bookings have surpassed Rs 50 crore, with strong overseas sales, particularly in North America where it exceeded 'Leo's premiere record. Domestically, pre-sales have overtaken 'Jailer', potentially marking Rajinikanth's biggest opening ever and a historic moment for Indian cinema.

title: 'Bumrah should‚Äôve been told to miss IPL': Vengsarkar defends pacer against critics
content: Former India captain Dilip Vengsarkar believed Jasprit Bumrah should have skipped IPL 2025 to stay fresh for the England Test series. He also suggested that Virat Kohli should have played the series before retiring. Vengsarkar emphasised the importance of Test cricket, highlighting standout performances from Siraj, Gill, Rahul, Jaiswal, Pant and Sundar. He defended Bumrah's workload management, citing his back surgery.

title: Mark Zuckerberg hired people at $100 mn-plus pay packages: Skills for job at Meta; Degree in‚Ä¶
content: Meta's CEO Mark Zuckerberg is aggressively pursuing top AI talent for a new superintelligence lab, targeting researchers from elite universities and leading companies like OpenAI and Google DeepMind. Zuckerberg personally oversees recruitment, offering lucrative packages to secure promising individuals.

title: ICMAI CMA toppers: Hans Amresh secures first rank in Finals- check top 10 here
content: The Institute of Cost Accountants of India (ICMAI) has announced the CMA June 2025 Intermediate and Final exam toppers, with Hans Amresh from Surat securing the first rank. The top 10 list features candidates from cities including Mumbai, Jaipur, Faridabad, and Bangalore, reflecting wide geographic representation and notable female participation in this year‚Äôs merit rankings.

title: 'Rapid service': Trump presses China import more soybeans to ease deficit
content: Donald Trump urged China to significantly increase its soybean orders to alleviate its shortage and reduce the trade deficit with the U.S., as the tariff truce between the two nations neared its end. Meanwhile, Trump is still considering imposing tariffs on China over its Russian oil purchases, with the decision complicated by broader aspects of the U.S.

title: Gunmen storm Syria hospital: Medic assaulted, shot at point-blank by armed men
content: A disturbing video from Sweida, Syria, shows armed men, allegedly Syrian military and security personnel, fatally shooting a medical worker at a hospital. The incident occurred during clashes between Druze militias, tribal groups, and government forces. Syrian authorities have launched an investigation to identify the perpetrators, vowing to bring them to justice regardless of affiliation, while activists claim the attackers were government forces.

title: Mahomes gets family, brother Jackson‚Äôs support after preseason benching
content: Patrick Mahomes, despite limited playtime in the preseason game against the Cardinals, demonstrated his readiness and leadership. After a brief appearance that included a touchdown pass, Mahomes shifted to a supportive role, advising teammates and offering insights to the coaching staff. Coach Reid praised Mahomes' leadership, emphasizing his importance to the team's Super Bowl aspirations.

title: Giant planet found orbiting tiny star ‚Äòshould not exist‚Äô, astronomers say
content: Astronomers have spotted a giant planet, TOI-6894b, orbiting a tiny red dwarf star, challenging existing planet formation theories. This gas giant, larger than Saturn but less massive, orbits a star only one-fifth the Sun's mass. The discovery suggests that large planets might be more common around small stars than previously believed.

title: Fans call out Kourtney Kardashian over son‚Äôs safety on boat
content: Kourtney Kardashian Barker faced online criticism after posting boat photos where her son, Rocky Thirteen, wasn't wearing a life jacket. Followers raised safety concerns, prompting Kourtney to purchase a life vest and acknowledge the oversight. This incident highlights a common issue: parents sometimes skip life jackets for reasons like short trips or discomfort.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens in green; BSE Sensex above 79,900
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in green on Monday. While Nifty50 was near 24,400, BSE Sensex was above 79,900.

title: 'Press badge isn‚Äôt a shield for terrorism': 5 Al Jazeera journalists killed in Israeli strike - 10 points
content: An Israeli strike near Gaza City's Al-Shifa Hospital resulted in the deaths of at least five Al Jazeera journalists, including correspondent Mohammed Qreiqeh and camera operators. The IDF confirmed targeting Al Jazeera correspondent Anas al-Sharif, alleging he was a Hamas terrorist operative, a claim Al Jazeera denies.

title: 'Not a court': Chidambaram slams EC over SIR; terms refusal to hear plaints ‚Äòdeath of democracy‚Äô
content: P Chidambaram criticized the Election Commission of India, stating it should not act as a court. He raised concerns about ignored complaints in Bihar during the Special Intensive Revision, potentially undermining democratic elections. The ECI has asked Rahul Gandhi to provide evidence for his "vote theft" allegations or apologize, following doubts about the authenticity of documents he presented.

title: ICMAI CMA results: Intermediate & Final exam scores out- check here
content: The Institute of Cost Accountants of India (ICMAI) has released the CMA June 2025 Intermediate and Final results on its official website, icmai.in. This session saw 5,491 candidates complete the Intermediate course and 2,167 clear the Final. Pass percentages varied across groups, reflecting mixed trends compared to December 2024, with some declines in key categories.

title: Tyreek Hill, ex Keeta Vaccaro rush baby Capri to ER; now recovering
content: Tyreek Hill's eight-month-old daughter, Capri, was rushed to the emergency room after developing alarming symptoms, causing significant concern for her mother, Keeta Vaccaro. Doctors swiftly stabilized Capri, and her condition improved by sunrise. Despite ongoing family turmoil, the outpouring of support from fans highlights the shared relief and gratitude for Capri's recovery.

title: 'Sir, we weren't even born': Mohammed Siraj hails 1983 World Cup hero
content: Mohammed Siraj honored Syed Kirmani at the Hyderabad launch of Kirmani's autobiography, acknowledging him as an inspiration. Siraj praised Kirmani's 1983 World Cup win and exceptional wicketkeeping skills. Kirmani reciprocated by commending Siraj's recent performance against England. Mohammed Azharuddin highlighted Kirmani's popularity and urged young wicketkeepers to seek his guidance.

title: Watch: Salman Khan breaks silence on not owning IPL team: ‚ÄòOffer tha, but‚Ä¶‚Äô
content: Salman Khan revealed he was offered an IPL team during the league's inception in 2008, but declined. He expressed no regrets, stating he's content with his decision. Khan is currently preparing for 'Battle of Galwan,' a physically demanding film based on the 2020 India-China conflict.

title: US-India tariff tension: Govt to brief Tharoor-led panel today on ties with Washington
content: The parliamentary standing committee on external affairs, led by Shashi Tharoor, will receive a briefing on India's foreign policy developments, particularly regarding US-India trade negotiations and tariffs. The MEA has stated that US secondary sanctions have placed India in an unwanted geopolitical contest, but India remains committed to constructive engagement.

title: Asia Cup: Hardik to undergo fitness assessment; Surya needs another week for full recovery
content: India's T20I captain Suryakumar Yadav is yet to fully recover from the sports hernia operation he underwent in June in Munich. He is expected to spend another week at the National Cricket Academy (NCA) under the watchful eyes of the physios and medical team. Meanwhile, Shreyas Iyer had cleared his fitness test last month.

title: 'Who will take care of my knee?' ‚Äî Dhoni keeps IPL future in suspense | Watch
content: Speculation surrounds MS Dhoni's future with Chennai Super Kings ahead of IPL 2026. Following a disappointing IPL 2025 season, the 43-year-old Dhoni, battling knee issues, remains undecided. He humorously addressed fan queries about his participation, citing knee pain concerns. Dhoni's knee has been a recurring issue, requiring surgery after their IPL 2023 victory.

title: Magic Johnson & Wife Cookie share heartfelt moment honouring Lakers legend‚Äôs mother
content: Magic Johnson celebrated his mother, Christine Johnson's, 90th birthday with a heartfelt party alongside his wife, Cookie, and their children. The event, filled with love and appreciation, honored Christine's life dedicated to the Lord. Gospel artist Tamela Mann surprised Christine with a performance, making the celebration even more special at Breslin Arena.

title: Uttarakhand: Flash flood changes Bhagirathi course; river returns to old path
content: Recent ISRO satellite images reveal the Bhagirathi river's dramatic reshaping due to a flash flood in Dharali, triggered by the erosion of a debris fan. The flood altered river channels, submerged buildings, and caused significant topographical shifts.

title: 2nd ODI: West Indies level series with five-wicket win over Pakistan in rain-hit clash
content: Roston Chase and Justin Greaves propelled the West Indies to a five-wicket victory over Pakistan in the rain-affected second ODI, leveling the series 1-1. Chasing a revised target of 181, the West Indies reached 184/5 with Chase's unbeaten 49 earning him Player of the Match. Earlier, Pakistan posted 171/7, with Jayden Seales taking 3-23.

title: Leylah Fernandez shares surprising dating news ahead of Cincinnati Open
content: Leylah Fernandez, fresh off her Washington victory, revealed she went on her first-ever date after a fan's message caught her eye in Montreal. Following careful vetting with her family's help, she met the fan, even going on a second date. Despite a loss at the Canadian Open, Fernandez feels balanced and ready for the Cincinnati Masters, balancing romance and tennis.

title: Josh Allen‚Äôs Buffalo date with Hailee Steinfeld sparks buzz after team‚Äôs loss
content: Josh Allen, despite not playing in the Bills' preseason opener, remains the focal point as he balances personal milestones with Super Bowl aspirations. Fresh off his marriage to Hailee Steinfeld, Allen's new 'stache and married life are buzzing among fans. His relentless pursuit of a championship fuels his dedication to finding the missing piece for Buffalo's success.

title: After NISAR mission, India to launch 6500-kg US communication sat: Isro chief
content: Following the successful launch of the NISAR satellite, ISRO is preparing to launch the US-built Block-2 BlueBird communication satellite. This satellite, weighing 6,500 kg, boasts advanced communication arrays for direct-to-smartphone broadband connectivity, eliminating the need for specialized terminals.

title: ‚ÄòSon of Sardaar 2‚Äô: Ajay Devgn & Mrunal Thakur‚Äôs comedy drama mints over Rs 3 crore on Sunday
content: Ajay Devgn's 'Son of Sardaar 2' has earned over Rs 40 crore in India within ten days, outperforming 'Dhadak 2'. Despite steady growth, it faces strong competition from 'Saiyaara' and 'Mahavatar Narsimha'. The film's future hinges on the release of 'War 2', which could significantly impact its box office performance. The movie is a mix of comedy, action, and drama.

title: IIT-Roorkee data breach: Details of 30k students, alumni out
content: A significant data privacy lapse at IIT-Roorkee has exposed the personal information of over 30,000 students and alumni on a public website for years. The leaked database includes sensitive details like mobile numbers, caste, financial background, and photographs. The institute has launched an internal inquiry into the breach, suspecting the data was siphoned from the academic affairs department.

title: Bobby Whitlock, Dominos co-founder and music legend, passes away at 77
content: Bobby Whitlock, the keyboardist-singer and co-founder of Dominos, has died at 77 after a brief illness. His wife, Coco Carmel, shared a heartfelt tribute, remembering his adventurous spirit and musical talent.

title: Insiders predict Connor McDavid will re-sign with Edmonton Oilers before NHL training camp
content: Connor McDavid may soon extend his contract with the Edmonton Oilers. Reports suggest a deal could finalize after Team Canada's camp this month. The extension might be for two or four years. The annual value could reach around $17.5 million. This move provides McDavid flexibility. It also gives the Oilers a clear championship focus. Fans await the official announcement.

title: Tamil Nadu Calls For Eco-Friendly Ganesha Idols To Avoid Water Pollution
content: With Ganesh Chaturthi set to be celebrated on August 27, the Tamil Nadu Pollution Control Board has issued a set of guidelines urging devotees to opt for eco-friendly idols and to ensure that immersion activities do not pollute waterbodies.

title: "Still In Shock": Labubu Dolls Worth $7,000 Stolen From Los Angeles Store
content: Toy vendor One Stop Sales said in an Instagram post that the thieves took all of the store's inventory and trashed the establishment.

title: Al Jazeera Journalist's "Final Message" Before Being Killed In Gaza Strike
content: The long message, which appeared to be pre-written, was posted by supposedly al-Sharif's friend after his death was confirmed.

title: After Mumbai, Tesla To Launch New Store In Delhi Today
content: Tesla is set to open its new Experience Centre today in New Delhi, marking a significant development in the India chapter of the US automobile major.

title: Chip Giants Nvidia, AMD To Give 15% Of China Sales To US Government
content: Nvidia and AMD have agreed to give the US government 15 per cent of revenue from sales to China of advanced computer chips like Nvidia's H20 that are used for artificial intelligence applications, a US official told Reuters on Sunday.

title: Bite Mark And Chilling CCTV Footage: 15-Month-Old's Horror At Noida Daycare
content: A woman attendant at a daycare in a Noida residential complex has been arrested after the parents of a 15-month-old baby girl accused her of assaulting the infant.

title: Parliament Monsoon Session Day 16 Live Updates: Key Legislative Bills In Lok Sabha; Manipur Budget And GST Bills On Rajya Sabha Agenda
content: The Lok Sabha is gearing up for the session today with questions, ministerial statements, committee reports, and high-stakes legislation on the table. The day will begin at 11:00 am with question hour.

title: 5 Al Jazeera Journalists Killed In Gaza Strike, Israel Says One Was "Hamas Terrorist"
content: At least five Al Jazeera journalists have been killed by an Israeli strike near Gaza City's Al-Shifa Hospital.

title: "We'll Take Half World Down With Us": Pak Army Chief Asim Munir's Nuclear Threat In US
content: Pakistan's Army Chief Asim Munir has openly warned of a "nuclear war" from American soil. Addressing an event in Tampa, Florida, Pakistan's de facto military ruler threatened to take down "half the world" if his country faced an existential threat in

title: 1 Dead, Many Buildings Collapse After 6.1 Earthquake In Turkey
content: A 6.1-magnitude quake struck Sindirgi in western Turkey on Sunday, the Turkish disaster management agency (AFAD) said, killing at least one person and injuring dozens more.

title: "Saved By Luck": Congress MP On "Harrowing Journey" On Air India Flight
content: According to Congress MP KC Venugopal, the Air India flight, which was already delayed for departure, was hit by unprecedented turbulence shortly after take-off and was diverted to Chennai an hour later.

title: Andhra Student Found Dead, Parents Protest Cover-Up By College Authorities
content: A first-year intermediate student was found dead under suspicious circumstances at a college in Nellore, Andhra Pradesh.

title: UP Man Celebrates Rakhi, Then Kills Sister, Days After Murdering Her Lover
content: A man, vexed with her 18-year-old sister's affair with a man, allegedly killed her after celebrating Raksha Bandhan in the Garautha area here, police on Sunday said.

title: Trump Planning To Deploy National Guard Troops In Washington: Report
content: The US military is preparing for the activation of hundreds of National Guard troops to Washington, DC, two US officials told Reuters on Sunday.

title: 'If Ratan Tata Was Here...': US Lawyer On Delay In Air India Crash Aid
content: The lead US attorney, Mike Andrews, representing over 65 families affected by the tragic AI171 plane crash said that "bureaucratic process" would not have existed if former Chairperson of the Tata Group, Ratan Tata, had been alive.

title: Bihar Deputy Chief Minister In Double Voter ID Row, Poll Body Sends Notice
content: A notice has been issued to Bihar's Deputy Chief Minister and senior BJP leader Vijay Kumar Sinha for allegedly possessing two voter ID cards and being registered as a voter in two places.

title: US Tourist In Puerto Rico For Bad Bunny Concert Fatally Shot
content: A US tourist who was visiting Puerto Rico for Bad Bunny's residency was fatally shot at La Perla, a popular seaside shantytown, police said.

title: Lights, Camera, Policy: Delhi To Get New Filming Plan To Attract Global Eye
content: Delhi is eyeing a place on the global film map, with Chief Minister Rekha Gupta announcing plans to roll out a new policy to position the national capital as an international shooting destination.

title: Assam Thadou Tribe Chief Defends Manipur Peace Meet, Calls For Unity
content: A Thadou tribe chief of a village in Assam's Dima Hasao has strongly condemned threats and online abuse against him for attending an event themed on peace in Manipur's capital Imphal.

title: Man Clings To Austrian High-Speed Train, Survives
content: A man has survived clinging to the outside of an Austrian high-speed train, Austria's state railway said, reportedly after it left whilst he was having a cigarette break.

title: Ganne cruises to win 1st U.S. Women's Amateur
content: megha Ganne wins three straight holes against mistake-prone Brooke Biermann . Ganne is 4 down with seven holes to play in the semifinals against Ella Scaysbrook . she has been chasing a USGA title for nearly a decade .

title: NBA's new financial rules threaten dynasties: 'Harder choices' for top teams
content: Iman Shumpert is looking forward to seeing how the Thunder respond after winning the title . since the Warriors won back-to-back titles in 2017 and 2018, the NBA has seen seven different champions hoist the Larry O'Brien Trophy . there have been 11 different finalists in each of the past six postseasons .

title: Defensive frailties dog Liverpool, but new signings show quality
content: Crystal Palace drew 2-2 with a 3-2 penalty shootout win at wembley on sunday . the win was the second in a matter of months for the premier league champions . it was their opponents' second win of the season after 2-1 defeat to Newcastle united .

title: How will Yankees manage busy bullpen?
content: the fantasy baseball buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around MLB . the game is the rubber game of the weekend between the St. Louis Cardinals and the Chicago Cubs . a left oblique strain was scratched from today's start and was placed on the 15-day IL with a . left strain .

title: NFL preseason Week 1 takeaways: Tyler Shough's debut a mixed bag for Saints
content: the 2025 preseason kicked off Thursday and continued through Sunday . several rookies played their first snaps, whether they were rookies or offseason acquisitions . quarterback jamaree Caldwell has shown why the Chargers selected him .

title: üèà Ultimate Fantasy Football Cheat Sheet
content: the ultimate ESPN fantasy football cheat sheet is a curated rundown of all the names we've been talking about this preseason . if you want to read more about sleepers, busts, rookies, backups, value picks and more, the analysis is available for you to pore through .
